sentences: Helen Fisher grew up in Mapua, Nelson, and attended secondary school in Wellington, New Zealand.
She graduated from Canterbury University in 1964 with a degree in English and taught English, music and French in New Zealand and Canadian secondary schools.
In 1987 she won first prize in the Victoria University's Composersâ€™ Competition with Woodwind Trio and in 1989  won second prize for Pounamu.
She graduated in composition in 1991 and began working as a composer.
In 1990 and 1991, Fisher held the Arts Council residency of Composer-in-Schools in the Wellington area.
In 1993, she co-founded the first New Zealand Composing Women's Festival.
